attributes.action: Re-open Gaydon Airfield for Civil Flying
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
RAF Gaydon is a former Royal Air Force station in Warwickshire in the UK.
During World War II an RAF station was built near the village. This was a standard three-runway airfield similar to a number of other airfields nearby and was used mainly for training bomber crews, using Wellington Bombers or their training variants. Immediately after the war bomber training ceased and Gaydon became a training establishment for glider pilots and gliding instructors.

The station closed in 1974 and the airfield was bought in 1978 by British Leyland, and became a proving ground for its cars. The old control tower is used to monitor and converse with the cars in testing.
I would like to see the airfield re-opened for civil flying as this would be very popular with Aviation Enthusiasts and it would also boost the local area and economy and increase tourism.
